alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:49PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 230 PM CDT... At 149 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brilliant, or near Winfield, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Gu- Win, Twin, Tucker and Texas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
